qas.question: When have humans started impacting the delta?
What increased in the Rhine because of the land clearance in the upland areas?
What has increased sediment and delta growth also produced in the Rhine?
How many avulsions have occurred in the past 6000 yeas?
When did embankment of the major Rhine distributaries take palce?
How long have humans been impacting the delta for?
How many years has Bronze Age agriculture gone on for?
How many upland areas are in central Germany?
How long did peat mining from the Roman times last for?
What centuries did the Roman times take place within?

context: Since <a0_1><a0_2>~<a0_0><b5_0>3000 yr BP<b5_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> (= years Before Present), human impact is seen in the delta. As a result of increasing land clearance (<a2_1>Bronze Age agriculture<a2_1/>), in the upland areas (central Germany), the <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2>sediment load<a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> of the Rhine has strongly increased and delta growth has sped up. This caused <a2_0><a2_2>increased flooding and sedimentation<a2_2/><a2_0/>, ending peat formation in the delta. The shifting of river channels to new locations, on the floodplain (termed avulsion), was the main process distributing sediment across the subrecent delta. Over the past <b6_0><b8_0>6000 years<b8_0/><b6_0/>, approximately <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><b7_0>80<b7_0/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> avulsions have occurred. Direct human impact in the delta started with peat mining, for salt and fuel, from Roman times onward. This was followed by embankment, of the major distributaries and damming of minor distributaries, which took place in the <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><b9_0>11–13th century<a4_0/> AD<b9_0/><a4_2/><a4_1/>. Thereafter, canals were dug, bends were short cut and groynes were built, to prevent the river's channels from migrating or silting up.
